intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium tergestinum, commonly known as the Edible Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, with a distinct basal rosette, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is known for its edible leaves, which have a slightly bitter taste and are used in traditional cuisine.
